item.title: Terrorism Risk Insurance Program Reauthorization Act of 2014

latestAction.text: Message on House action received in Senate and at desk: House amendment to Senate bill.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 231 - 189 (Roll no. 554). (text: CR H8962)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 231 - 189 (Roll no. 554).(text: CR H8962)
The previous question was ordered without objection. (consideration: CR H8966-8967)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 775.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H8962-8967)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 149.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 113-654, by Mr. Sessions.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 113-654, by Mr. Sessions.
Resolution provides for consideration of S. 2244; provides suspension authority; and provides for proceedings through Jan. 3, 2015.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (S. 2244) to extend the termination date of the Terrorism Insurance Program established under the Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules; and providing for proceedings during the period from December 12, 2014, through January 3, 2015.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (S. 2244) to extend the termination date of the Terrorism Insurance Program established under the Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules; and providing for proceedings during the period from December 12, 2014, through January 3, 2015.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
